aRchaic
  • Reference

Function to check if the signatures should be clubbed

Validity check whether the C->T and G->A signatures should be clubbed. This function reads in the matrix of signature counts produced by the aggregate_bin_counts and plots the C->T and G->A mutations for each sample.

club_signature_validation_plot(signature_counts, flanking_bases = 2,
  cex = 1, col = "red", pch = 20, xlab = "C->T", ylab = "G->A",
  lty = 1, lwd = 1, mar = c(5, 4, 4, 4), log = FALSE)

Arguments

signature_counts
The matrix of counts of all signatures as produced by aggregate_bin_counts.
flanking_bases
The number of flanking bases. Defaults to 2.
cex
The size of the dots used for plotting
col
The color of the dot
pch
The shape of the dot
xlab
The X-axis label
ylab
The Y-axis label
lty
The line type of the dot
lwd
The line width of the dot
mar
The margin of the plot
log
if TRUE, the lof of the counts are plotted, else plot on original scale. Default is FALSE.

Value

Returns a plot of number of C->T versus number of G->A mutations for each sample.

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
